div.p: Ensuring ALL individual learners reach their full potential.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

th.span: All Scottsdale Unified schools are closed to students and the public. Todas las escuelas del Distrito Escolar Unificado de Scottsdale estn cerradas a los estudiantes y al pblico.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: MARCH 30, 2020 UPDATE: Governor Doug Ducey has announced that schools in Arizona will remain closed for the reminder of the 2019-2020 school year. At this time, all Scottsdale Unified schools and campuses are closed to students, staff and the public. This closure includes the recreational fields, campus parking lots, playground equipment, running tracks and sport courts. All students are now taking part in online learning. For more information on online learning, please visit www.susd.org/eLearning. Since campuses remain closed, the best way to reach our staff is through email. You may find a listing of our schools at www.susd.org/Schools.

This web page is designed to provide a synopsis how the Scottsdale Unified School District (SUSD) has and will continue protect student and staff health and well-being during this period of national emergency related to the COVID-19 situation. This web page chronicles all of the efforts of SUSD, including our communications to parents dating back to January 2020. For the very latest announcements from the District, be sure to visitwww.susd.org/Newsand follow the District and your favorite SUSD schools on social media. A listing of our accounts is atwww.susd.org/Connect.
